$note: windows is not officially supported by pufferpanel so this template only works on linux
name: minecraft-paper-sleep

install.text:
serverName: Server offline, join to start...
serverPort: ${port}
bedrockPort: 0
maxPlayers: 20
loginMessage: Server is starting, rejoin in a few seconds...
serverOnlineMode: true
webPort: 0
startMinecraft: 1
minecraftCommand: ${java} -Xms${memory}M -Xmx${memory}M -Dterminal.jline=false -Dterminal.ansi=true -Djline.terminal=jline.UnsupportedTerminal -XX:+UseG1GC -XX:+ParallelRefProcEnabled -XX:MaxGCPauseMillis=200 -XX:+UnlockExperimentalVMOptions -XX:+DisableExplicitGC -XX:+AlwaysPreTouch -XX:G1NewSizePercent=30 -XX:G1MaxNewSizePercent=40 -XX:G1HeapRegionSize=8M -XX:G1ReservePercent=20 -XX:G1HeapWastePercent=5 -XX:G1MixedGCCountTarget=4 -XX:InitiatingHeapOccupancyPercent=15 -XX:G1MixedGCLiveThresholdPercent=90 -XX:G1RSetUpdatingPauseTimePercent=5 -XX:SurvivorRatio=32 -XX:+PerfDisableSharedMem -XX:MaxTenuringThreshold=1 -Dusing.aikars.flags=https://mcflags.emc.gs -Daikars.new.flags=true -jar paper.jar
 version: ${version}

build.desc: Build of Paper to install (Paper version build). Must be specified as a build number, e.g. 484

eula.desc: Do you agree to the Minecraft EULA?

ip.desc: What IP to bind the server to

java.desc: "java" for system standard, else direct path to java

memory.desc: How much memory in MB to allocate to the Java Heap

motd.desc: This is the message that is displayed in the server list of the client, below the name. The MOTD does support color and formatting codes.
motd.value: A Minecraft Server\n\u00A79 hosted on PufferPanel

port.desc: What port to bind the server to

version.desc: Version of Minecraft to install (Paper maintained versions). Must be specified as a release number, e.g. 1.16.5
